metadata.title: Puppies Learn With Love
metadata.objective: Understand how consistent care and gentle training help a puppy feel safe and learn fast.

narration.voiceOver: Let’s talk about puppies—love, consistency, and tiny habits. I’ll read what appears and guide you through three simple choices. You choose when you’re ready; I’ll help either way.

show.text: Puppies learn best with calm, consistent cues and kindness.

narration.voiceOver: Question one. What helps a puppy feel safe? Option A: loud corrections when they mess up. Option B: calm routines with clear, gentle cues. I’ll read both, then you choose.

show.text: What helps a puppy feel safe?
Exactly—safety grows when cues are calm and predictable.
Loud corrections can scare; safety grows with calm, consistent cues.

question.text: What helps a puppy feel safe?

teachingMoments.a: Fear slows learning; calm patterns build trust.

narration.voiceOver: Question two. What speeds up training? Option A: tiny steps with quick rewards. Option B: waiting until the puppy is perfect to reward. Choose whenever you’re ready.

show.text: Yes—small wins add up fast when you reward right away.
Waiting too long confuses the puppy; quick rewards teach what to repeat.

teachingMoments.a: Exactly—reward tiny progress right away to shape behavior.
teachingMoments.b: Delaying reward muddles the message; fast feedback teaches clearly.

narration.voiceOver: Question three. What’s a kind habit for hard moments? Option A: pause, breathe, and reset the routine. Option B: keep pushing louder. Pick what fits care and learning.

show.text: What’s a kind habit for hard moments?
Right—calm resets teach the next right step.
Louder often adds stress. Calm resets create safety and focus.

question.text: What’s a kind habit for hard moments?

teachingMoments.a: Exactly—calm resets keep trust and learning.
teachingMoments.b: Volume adds confusion; calm brings clarity.

narration.voiceOver: Your takeaway: be the calm your puppy learns from—tiny steps, quick rewards, and kind resets. Try one small habit today.

show.text: Be the calm your puppy learns from—tiny steps, quick rewards, kind resets.
